alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Florence (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 30 at 9:44AM EDT until further notice by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wilmington NC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Carolina...South Carolina... Northeast Cape Fear River Near Burgaw affecting Pender County. Lumber River Near Lumberton affecting Robeson County. Lumber River 1 SE Nichols affecting Marion, Horry and Dillon Counties. Little Pee Dee River At Galivants Ferry affecting Marion and Horry Counties. Great Pee Dee River At Pee Dee affecting Marion and Florence Counties. Black Creek At Quinby affecting Florence and Darlington Counties. Lynches River At Effingham affecting Florence County. Black River At Kingstree affecting Williamsburg County. For the Northeast Cape Fear River...including Burgaw...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Lumber River...including Nichols, Pembroke, Lumberton Usgs Gage, Maxton, Lumberton, Boardman...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Little Pee Dee River...including Galivants Ferry...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Great Pee Dee River...including Bennettsville 10sw, Pee Dee...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Black Creek...including Black Creek Nr Hartsville, Quinby... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Lynches River...including Effingham...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Black River...including Kingstree...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black Creek at Quinby. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Floodwaters deepen on Creekside Drive, East Black Creek Road, and Crooked Creek Drive. Flood waters spread onto Cyprus Bend Road into the Country Club of South Carolina. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 4.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue rising to a crest of 16.3 feet early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=ilm . The next statement will be issued by late tonight.
